programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Sparks and Liberty match up for the first time this season. New York claimed two of the three meetings with Los Angeles during the 2022 campaign. Liberty star Sabrina Ionescu averaged 21.7 points, 7.7 rebounds and six assists in those contests.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Yankees and Orioles play under the lights at Camden Yards. Baltimore lit up New York starter Luis Severino (2-4, 6.46 ERA) for seven runs in 2 2/3 innings July 6. Gunnar Henderson (BAL) was 3-for-3 off Severino with a homer and two RBIs.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Rico DiSciullo, the final fighter who can prevent Team McGregor from being the first team in TUF history to lose all their quarterfinal fights, faces Team Chandler's Hunter Azure.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: The TUF semifinalist matchups are revealed, and Team Chandler's Roosevelt Roberts and Austin Hubbard are the first to face off to determine who advances to the live finale.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: Compelling stories centered around sports and athletes, ranging from dramatic to comedic.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: Excel Esports: All-Star Battle
programme.desc: Excel pros compete in tasks featuring the spreadsheet software.

programme.title: Ultimate Disc
programme.desc: Non-contact team sport flying disc action.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: USA plays Vietnam at Eden Park in Auckland in the opening game of Group E at the 2023 World Cup. USA also faced Asian opposition in its opening fixture of the 2019 World Cup, a 13-0 win against Thailand in Reims (including five goals by Alex Morgan).

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: USA plays Netherlands at Wellington Regional Stadium in Group E of the 2023 World Cup. This fixture is a repeat of the 2019 World Cup final. USA retained the trophy courtesy of a 2-0 win at Groupama Stadium (goals by Megan Rapinoe and Rose Lavelle).

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: England plays Denmark at Sydney Football Stadium in Group D of the 2023 World Cup. This is the first World Cup meeting, but the teams have met at two European championships. England won in the 1984 semi-finals and Denmark won in the 2005 group stage.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Australia is up against Nigeria at Brisbane Stadium in Group B of the 2023 World Cup. The only previous World Cup meeting between these teams was in the 2015 group stage. The Matildas won 2-0 in Winnipeg courtesy of two goals scored by Kyah Simon.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the FIFA Women's World Cup, hosted by Australia and New Zealand.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup Live
programme.desc: Host Rob Stone discusses the highlights and news stories of the day's action plus previews of upcoming matches. Featuring Alexi Lalas, Kelly Smith, Ari Hingst, Heather O'Reilly, Kate Gill, Karina LeBlanc and Eni Aluko.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Sweden plays Italy at Wellington Regional Stadium in Group G of the 2023 World Cup. This is the first World Cup meeting. Italy lost five of its six matches versus Sweden at the European championships, but recorded a 3-2 win in the 2017 group stage.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: Our news team constantly breaks exclusive stories featuring the biggest stars in sports.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub
programme.desc: Highlights, news, opinion, and a heavy dose of unexpected fun from the always-rocking world of NASCAR.

programme.title: Dirt: The Last Great American Sport
programme.desc: This season of DIRT follows NASCAR cup champion Kyle Larson as he shifts gears into the mayhem of dirt track racing. Fast, dangerous, and out of control, this is the last great American sport.

programme.desc: Competition from the highest level of professional bass fishing tournaments.

programme.title: MLB on FS1 Pregame
programme.desc: Previews of the day's games, highlights, updates and analysis.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Johnny Cueto looks to keep rolling as his Marlins continue an interleague set with the Tigers. The 37-year-old right-hander has allowed just three hits and one run in his last nine innings. Spencer Torkelson (DET) doubled off Cueto last season.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay - NCTS
programme.desc: Live prerace coverage of the day's NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series race. Hosted by Kaitlyn Vincie with analysis from Todd Bodine and Trevor Bayne.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series heads to Richmond Raceway in Virginia for the Worldwide Express 250. Kyle Busch increased his record-setting total of Truck Series victories to 65 with a checkered flag at the CRC Brakleen 150 at Pocono on July 22.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: The NHRA is the world's fastest and most explosive motorsport, featuring Top Fuel Dragsters, Funny Cars, Pro Stock Cars and Motorcycles. Racers compete head-to-head on a 1000-foot or quarter-mile drag strip at speeds over 330 miles per hour.

programme.desc: Norway plays Philippines at Eden Park in Auckland in the final round of games in Group A of the 2023 World Cup. This match features the 1995 World Cup winners and one of the eight tournament debutants in the 2023 edition in Australia and New Zealand.

programme.desc: The last word on the day's action from the FIFA Women's World Cup.

programme.desc: Germany is up against Colombia at Sydney Football Stadium in Group H of the 2023 World Cup. Germany is unbeaten in all five World Cup matches versus South American opposition, including a 2-0 victory against Brazil in the 2007 final in Shanghai.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Canada plays Australia at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in Group B of the 2023 World Cup. The only World Cup meeting between the nations was a 2-2 group stage draw in Chengdu in 2007. Cheryl Salisbury scored a 92nd-minute equaliser for the Matildas.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Japan is up against Spain at Wellington Regional Stadium in the final round of games in Group C of the 2023 World Cup. Spain defeated Japan 1-0 in a friendly in Seville on Nov. 15, 2022. The only goal of the match was scored by Alba Redondo.

programme.title: Champions Revealed: 2014 San Antonio Spurs
programme.desc: The Spurs' Gregg Popovich, Tim Duncan, Tony Parker and Manu Ginobili sit down following last year's NBA Finals win to reflect on the building of a dynasty, how their relationships have developed over the years and the satisfaction of this past year's championship season.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Manu Ginobili scores 48 points, Tim Duncan scores 30 points and 19 rebounds and the Spurs rally from a 17-point 4th quarter deficit to defeat the Suns. From Jan. 21, 2005.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Manu Ginobili had 33 points and a career-high 11 rebounds for the Spurs held on to beat the Suns 114-106 and avoided a Game 7. Tony Parker had 30 points for San Antonio, while Tim Duncan had 24 points, 13 rebounds and a career-high nine blocks.

programme.title: NB80's

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: "Showtime" comes to Los Angeles; Moses Malone wins the elusive NBA title.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: The 1984 NBA Draft, the Celtics and Lakers battle for supremacy, and All-Star Weekend introduces the Slam Dunk Contest.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: Larry Bird and Magic Johnson battle for league and MVP titles; Spud Webb secures a spot in All-Star history; Dr. J says goodbye.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: Lakers win back-to-back titles; Pistons on the verge of dominance; Michael Jordan hits a "shot" to remember.

programme.title: NB90's

programme.title: NB90's

programme.desc: Michael Jordan tries a new game; Chris Webber is the top rookie; Hakeem Olajuwon makes Houston's dreams come true.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Luka Doncic scored 41 points in his NBA-leading fifth triple-double as the Dallas Mavericks held off the Golden State Warriors, 116-113, in a Western Conference finals rematch. Stephen Curry led the Warriors with 32 points. From Nov. 29, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Jamal Murray's 3-pointer with 0.9 seconds remaining lifted the Nuggets to a thrilling 121-120 victory over the Blazers. Damian Lillard had 40 points for the Portland, including a 3-pointer that gave them a one-point lead with 8.8 seconds remaining.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Jalen Suggs recorded a career-high 26 points, nine assists and four steals while top pick Paolo Banchero added 22 points for the Orlando Magic in the 130-129 victory over the Golden State Warriors. From Nov. 3, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: From Feb. 24, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Donovan Mitchell set a franchise record with 71 points, the most by an NBA player in 17 years, and the Cavs rallied from 21 down to beat the Bulls 145-134 in OT. Mitchell's total matched the 8th highest in league history. From Jan. 2, 2023.

programme.desc: Kevin Durant scored 37 points, including the go-ahead shot, to lift the Suns to a 130-126 victory over the Mavericks in a thrilling showcase of stars for both teams. From March 5, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: De'Aaron Fox knocked down a 3 as time expired as the Kings beat the Magic, 126-123, in OT. Fox recorded 37 points, five rebounds and three assists for the Kings, while Paolo Banchero tallied a career-high 33 points and 16 rebounds. From Nov. 5, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Stephen Curry hit a tying 3-pointer with 1:18 to play, a go-ahead layup moments later off a perfect, long pass by Kevon Looney, then one more dagger 3 on the way to 40 points, rallying the Warriors past the Cavaliers 106-101. From Nov. 11, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: LeBron James scored 37 points, Dennis Schroder made two free throws with 3.6 seconds left and the Lakers beat the Kings. De'Aaron Fox had 34 points and nine assists for Sacramento, who missed a halfcourt shot at the buzzer. From Jan. 7, 2023.

programme.desc: Jordan Poole scored the winning layup with a second remaining to cap a crazy back-and-forth final minute, and the Golden State Warriors fought back to beat the Memphis Grizzlies, 122-120. From Jan. 25, 2023.

programme.desc: From March 22, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Joel Embiid scored a career-high 59 points and added 11 rebounds, 8 assists and 7 blocks in a historically dominant performance, powering the 76ers to a 105-98 victory over the Jazz. From Nov. 13, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo scored 20 of his 54 points in the fourth quarter and the Milwaukee Bucks overcame a 21-point deficit to beat the Los Angeles Clippers, 106-105, for their sixth consecutive victory. From Feb. 2, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Donovan Mitchell set a franchise record with 71 points, the most by an NBA player in 17 years, and the Cavs rallied from 21 down to beat the Bulls 145-134 in OT. Mitchell's total matched the 8th highest in league history. From Jan. 2, 2023.
